definition: to clear up/to tidy up/to dispose of
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
to purge the ranks

sentences.english: Test, tweak, rinse and repeat until you succeed.
sentences.chinese: 在你成功之前，测试，调节，清理和重做。

sentences.english: II. 199 foreign business invested commercial enterprises need to make rectifications after sorting out.
sentences.chinese: 经过清理需要进行整改的外商投资商业企业199家。

sentences.english: The manual said it was self-cleaning.
sentences.chinese: 使用手册上说它是自动清理的。

sentences.english: Clean up any beads of mercury by using an index card and plastic dustpan.
sentences.chinese: 用扑索引卡和塑料簸箕清理水银珠子。

sentences.english: The glass also must be cleaned after each scan.
sentences.chinese: 每次扫描后，还得清理玻璃板。

sentences.english: It is the collapsing of the Expander that triggers the Adorer clean up code.
sentences.chinese: 这是崩溃的膨胀触发崇拜者清理代码。

sentences.english: Eating utensils and food trays are cleaned at the hygiene station with premoistened towelettes.
sentences.chinese: 就餐器具和食物盘在卫生站用预先弄湿的小毛巾清理。

sentences.english: After dinner, the table is cleared and moved outside and mattresses laid down.
sentences.chinese: 晚餐后矮桌清理干净并移到外面，地上铺上了床垫。

sentences.english: Clean the bearings, or replace them if worn out.
sentences.chinese: 清理轴承，如果已经用坏，请更换新轴承。

sentences.english: What if a hurricane comes along and obliterates the dunes entirely?
sentences.chinese: 如果刮来一场飓风把沙丘都清理干净了怎么办？

sentences.english: Two downtown Portland parks where Occupy Portland demonstrators camped for weeks are clear Monday and police say crews will be removing debris and assessing damage.
sentences.chinese: 波特兰两个示威者宿营的城市公园在周一得到了清理。

sentences.english: Next you should clean up the hard disk.
Police then rushed to the scene to sort out the horse and Luo Tuoqing meeting place.
sentences.chinese: 警方随后赶赴现场将马和骆驼清理出集会场所。

sentences.english: From now onwards will focus on sprucing up village land violations.
sentences.chinese: 从即日起保定市将集中清理各种土地违法行为。

sentences.english: The presence of rough surfaces or ledges make the room difficult to clean.
sentences.chinese: 粗糙的表面或壁架的存在使房间很难清理。

sentences.english: Maintenance and clean-up work after building is also essential to constructions.
sentences.chinese: 建后维护及清理工作对建筑来说也十分必要。

to clear/to empty

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)
